p: Many molecular and cellular profiling assays are now available for the study of the human immune system ( Fig. 4 ). The level of advancement of instruments has increased (e.g., polychromatic flow cytometers have improved). In the fields of genomics and proteomics, major technological breakthroughs have also occurred, creating a unique facility for the study of human beings in health and disease where inherent heterogeneity dictates that large collections of samples be analyzed [ 29].
